<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="167"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The support for the situation where one or both of the symbols would</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="168"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// require a local relocation is handled just like if the symbols were</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="169"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// external.  This is certainly used in the case of debug sections where the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="170"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// section has only temporary symbols and thus the symbols don&#39;t have base</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="171"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// symbols.  This is encoded using the section ordinal and non-extern</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="174"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Darwin &#39;as&#39; doesn&#39;t emit correct relocations for this (it ends up with a</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00287" /><CodeLine lineNumber="287"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00288" /><CodeLine lineNumber="288"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The Darwin x86&#95;64 relocation format has a problem where it cannot</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00289" /><CodeLine lineNumber="289"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// encode an address (L&lt;foo&gt; + &lt;constant&gt;) which is outside the atom</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00290" /><CodeLine lineNumber="290"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// containing L&lt;foo&gt;. Generally, this shouldn&#39;t occur but it does</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00291" /><CodeLine lineNumber="291"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// happen when we have a RIPrel instruction with data following the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00292" /><CodeLine lineNumber="292"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// relocation entry (e.g., movb $012, L0(%rip)). Even with the PCrel</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00293" /><CodeLine lineNumber="293"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// adjustment Darwin x86&#95;64 uses, the offset is still negative and the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00294" /><CodeLine lineNumber="294"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// linker has no way to recognize this.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00295" /><CodeLine lineNumber="295"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00296" /><CodeLine lineNumber="296"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// To work around this, Darwin uses several special relocation types</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00297" /><CodeLine lineNumber="297"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// to indicate the offsets. However, the specification or</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00298" /><CodeLine lineNumber="298"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// implementation of these seems to also be incomplete; they should</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00299" /><CodeLine lineNumber="299"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// adjust the addend as well based on the actual encoded instruction</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00300" /><CodeLine lineNumber="300"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// (the additional bias), but instead appear to just look at the final</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00301" /><CodeLine lineNumber="301"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// offset.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00302" /><CodeLine lineNumber="302"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">switch</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (-(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/target">Target</a>.getConstant() + (1LL &lt;&lt; Log2Size))) &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00427" /><CodeLine lineNumber="427"><span class="doxyHighlight">                   (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/macho/#ad23021ed657c8b0f302154585b0fd3bfa68f11d43f43d0655552891251d51d499">MachO::GENERIC&#95;RELOC&#95;PAIR</a> &lt;&lt; 24) | </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// r&#95;type</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00431" /><CodeLine lineNumber="431"><span class="doxyHighlight">    MRE.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/macho/any-relocation-info/#aff97edf4109298178b12aca5621bd6ec">r&#95;word1</a> = Value2;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00432" /><CodeLine lineNumber="432"><span class="doxyHighlight">    Writer-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machobjectwriter/#a40b113871f6a7036554ee273f6c989fe">addRelocation</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">, Fragment-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcfragment/#a7b98ffc5ede97acf84a20b7476d3ffff">getParent</a>(), MRE);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00433" /><CodeLine lineNumber="433"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">else</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00434" /><CodeLine lineNumber="434"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If the offset is more than 24-bits, it won&#39;t fit in a scattered</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00435" /><CodeLine lineNumber="435"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// relocation offset field, so we fall back to using a non-scattered</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00436" /><CodeLine lineNumber="436"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// relocation. This is a bit risky, as if the offset reaches out of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00437" /><CodeLine lineNumber="437"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the block and the linker is doing scattered loading on this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00438" /><CodeLine lineNumber="438"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// symbol, things can go badly.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00439" /><CodeLine lineNumber="439"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
